name: Aeronauts
job_description: travels or drives a hot-air balloon or any other kind of flying craft at the tiime.

job_description: workers skilled in all the different jobs required in agriculture.

job_description: workers who learned the trade while working at a discount

name: Architect
job_description: someone who designs buildings and in many cases also builds the building themselves with the help of others.

name: Auctioneers
job_description: conducts auctions by accepting bids and declaring when somethiing is sold. Common auctions are bidding for horses and donkeys for farm work as well as other aniimals.

name: Authors
job_description: people who write books or letters, notes, essays, narratives, etc.

name: Baggagemen
job_description: people or attendents who took care of baggage. They made sure that all and everyone's baggage was taken care of.

name: Barbers
job_description: someone who cuts hair and shaves/trims beards as a job

name: bellhop
job_description: a man or a boy employed in a hotel, club. to carry luggage and answer calls for service.

name: Blacksmiths
job_description: persona who makes and repairs things in iron by hand. Blacksmiths make iron and steel tools, but the most well known object that they create is horseshoes.

name: Boarding/lodging house keepers
job_description: Owners of managers of lodging/boarding houses. A lodging/boarding house held persons being strangers to one another, that is, not being of the same family, and promiscuously brought together, are allowed to occupy the same room’

name: bookbinders
job_description: Attach endpapers to tops and bottoms of book bodies, using sewing machines, or glue endpapers and signatures together along spines, using brushes or glue machines.

name: Bookkeepers
job_description: keep the financial records for a business up to date.

name: Butlers
job_description: main male servant in the home of a wealthy person. Usually responsiblie for serving food and in charge of the kitchen.Some butlers tend gardens and drive weathly people where they want to go.

name: cabinetmakers
job_description: specialized trade making high quality furniture. Popular items included tables, chairs, and desks.

name: Carpenters
job_description: person who makes and repairs wooden objects and structures. Some things carpenters make include: cabinents, houses, doors, window structures, and even floors.

name: Cashiers
job_description: handles payments and receipts in a store, bank, or other business.

name: Civil Engineer
job_description: An engineer whose training or occupation is in the designing and construction of public or private works, such as railroads.

name: coachmen
job_description: driver of a horse-drawn carriage. Usually a coachmen serves a wealthy family.

name: coal Laborers
job_description: workers skilled in all the different jobs required to get to the coal underground, loosen it from the earth, break it into pieces that mules or humans (and later power machines) could handle, transport it out of the mine, sort and clean it, and finally ship off it to customers. "Miners" worked inside the mine; "company men" worked outside the mine.

name: Dairy Farmers
job_description: farmers use nimals for production of dairy. Mostly use dairy cows for the production of dairy milk.

name: DairyWomen
job_description: deliver milk to your door.

name: day Laborers
job_description: These workers did whatever physical jobs they could find, usually hired for just days or weeks at a time.

name: Detectives
job_description: a police officer whose occupation is to investigate and solve crimes.

name: domestic Laborers
job_description: workers skilled in all the different jobs required in domestic and personal service industry.

name: DoorKeepers
job_description: employed to guard an entrance or gateway and is responsible for deciding who gets through an entrance.

name: Draftsmen
job_description: is a person who makes detailed technical drawings or plans for machinery, buildings, electronics, infrastructure, sections, etc.

name: Draymen
job_description: someone who drove wagons pulled by horses that was used to transport all kinds of goods. Most of the transportation trips were short.

name: Editors
job_description: people who are in charge of and determines the final content of text. Editors edit text to make little changes to perfect or make teh text sound or look better.

name: Electricians
job_description: someone who installs and maintains electrical equipment.

name: Elevator Operator
job_description: manually operate elevators, letting passengers on and off at their desired floors.

name: Farmers
job_description: workers who labor on a farm. Work includes a combination of raising field crops, orchhards, vineyards, poultry, or livestock.

name: fishermen
job_description: A commercial fisherman, also known as a fisher, uses equipment like nets, fishing rods, and traps, to catch fish and other marine life that will be consumed by humans or used as animal feed or bait. Some work as members of large crews on big boats in deep water. Other fishermen work in shallow water on small boats with a very small crew

name: Flagmen
job_description: someone at night with a lantern, waves it to people crossing the railroad to let them know if it is okay to cross the railroad or not. In the daytime the flagmen uses a flag instead of a lantern.

name: Florists
job_description: sell and/or arrange plants and flowers. Ability to tend gardern and produce the plants and flowers for arrangements. In addition, ability to cut and arrange flowers artisitically.

name: Freight Agents
job_description: people whoo coordinate inccoming and outgoing shipments to be transported to companies and other businesses

name: Fruit Growers
job_description: grow fruit to sell for money.

name: Gardeners
job_description: provide work involving tending a garden. Responsibilities include but are not limited to watering plants and foods, pulling weeds and keeping garden clean.

name: glassworkers
job_description: would remove a finished piece of hot glassware from the end of the gaffer's blow iron by cracking it off

name: Hostlers
job_description: a man employed to look after the horses of people staying at an inn.

name: Hucksters
job_description: a person who sells small items, either door-to-door or from a stall or small store.

name: Knocker-Upper
job_description: Served the sole purpose of getting people out of bed in the morniing

name: Laborers
job_description: Florists sell and arrange flowers that they grow themselves or obtain from wholesalers.

name: Ladies maids
job_description: female personal attendent who waits on the lady of the house. A lady's maid has a very similiar position of a butler.

name: launders/laundresses
job_description: responsible for washing clothes

name: Librarians
job_description: someone who works professionally in a library and can hold a degree iin librarianship.

name: Lighthouse Keepers
job_description: takes care of a lighthouse and keeps it clean. Watches for boats coming in at night to help guide them to the shore with the light.

name: Lumbermen
job_description: cut trees into logs. Transport logs to sawmill and cut logs.

name: Machinists
job_description: someone who operates a machine especiallt machine tools.

name: Manicurists
job_description: someone who performs manicures

name: Marshals
job_description: an officer of the highest rank in the armed forces of some countries.

name: Messengers
job_description: carries a message or goes on an errand for someone else especially as a matter of duty or business.

name: MilkMan
job_description: deliver milk to your door.

name: Night Watchmen
job_description: Night watchmen were on patrol, usually in pairs, from around 9pm until sunrise and their job was to challenge anyone who seemed suspicious, unauthorised street traders and “any person casting night soil in the street”

name: Oestopaths
job_description: therapists who manipulates the skeleton and the muscles.

name: Office Boys
job_description: employed in an office to run errands and do small tasks and jobs.

name: Overseer
job_description: Worker in charge of another group of workers in a factory, mine, rail yard, construction site or plantation.

name: Physicians
job_description: one who practices medicine through maintaining or restoring human health through the studiies and diagnosis to treate the disease, illness, injury or other physical or mental disability.

name: pick miner
job_description: Loosens coal with picks, drills, and explosives, then loads it onto cars. Paid by the carload of coal. (When we think of "coalminer" we usually picture a pick miner.)

name: Plumber
job_description: someone who installs and repairs the pipes and fittings of water supply, sanitation, or heating systems.

name: professioinal showmen
job_description: A person who produces or presents shows as a profession, skilled at entertaining, theatrical presentation or performance.

name: Proprietors
job_description: Owner of a business or in charge of a holder of property

name: Radio Actor
job_description: people who acted our dramas via radio.

name: Raftsmen
job_description: men ride logs down river as a means of getting them to the mills.

name: railway Laborers
job_description: workers skilled in all the different jobs required to work on the railroad.

name: Reporters
job_description: someone who reports news or conducts interviews for any type of newspaper and/or radio station

name: Retail Dealer
job_description: Someone who sells goods individually or in small quantities

name: Sailors
job_description: work as a member of the crew of a commerical or naval ship or boat, especially one who is below the rank of offiicer.

name: Salesmen
job_description: selliing or promoting commericial products either in a store or visiting locations to get orders on what to promote.

name: Saloon keepers
job_description: a person who owns or operates a saloon.

name: Soldiers
job_description: A person who serves in the army

name: steel Laborers
job_description: workers skilled in all the different jobs required in steel industry.

name: Stenographers
job_description: write down the words that someone says using shorthand.

name: Stock Raisers
job_description: raise and/or breed livestock such as beef cattle, dairy cows, goats, sheep, chickens, etc.

name: Stockbrokers
job_description: someone who buys and sells securities on a stock exchange for benefit off a client

name: Store Clerks
job_description: someone who checks out items from a store and makes sure they are paid for.

name: Surveyor
job_description: One who applies geometry and trigonometry to determine the area of any portion of the earth's surface, the lengths and directions of the bounding lines, and the contour of the surface, and accurately delineates the whole on paper.

name: Switchmen
job_description: railroad worker who is responsibile for operating signals and switches when a train is approaching. Swichmen have switches or cranks they have to pull to change the direction of the track the way the train would like to go.

name: Teacher
job_description: Teachers create lesson plans and teach those plans to the entire class, individually to students or in small groups, track student progress and present the information to parents, create tests, create and reinforce classroom rules,

name: Teacher
job_description: Teachers create lesson plans and teach those plans to the entire class, individually to students or in small groups, track student progress and present the information to parents, create tests, create and reinforce classroom rules,

name: Teamsters
job_description: a driver of a team of animals, mostly horses. They carried passengers and not goods.

name: teamsters
job_description: a person who drives a team of horses, especially in hauling freight., modern day truck driver.

name: Typewriters
job_description: able to use a typewriter that prints out what is typed.

name: Watchmen
job_description: employed to look aftter an empty buildiing especiially at night.

name: Woodchoppers
job_description: a person who competes to see who can cut through a tree the fastest.

name: Yardmen
job_description: someone who works on a railroad track. Yardmen put the actual tracks together to make a railroad.
